intro: Lippia pauciserrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, and it is valued for its essential oils. Lippia pauciserrata thrives in well-drained soils and is commonly found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
